content: Inflation. Plain and simple. I'm an accountant, I watch every dollar. And every month it seems like the same groceries, the same gas, costs more. It's not sustainable.
participant_profile: F, 51, Accountant, Brookfield, registered Republican, Romney-Trump-Trump voter, economically focused
preceding_moderator_q: Thank you all for joining us tonight. Let's start with how you're experiencing the economy right now. What's top of mind?

content: Same here. My salary went up 3% this year. Inflation is at 8%. I'm actually making less money in real terms than I was a year ago. That's backwards.
participant_profile: M, 52, IT director, Hartland, independent but votes Republican on economics, concerned about inflation
preceding_moderator_q: Thank you all for joining us tonight. Let's start with how you're experiencing the economy right now. What's top of mind?

content: I run a landscaping business. My costs are up - fuel, fertilizer, labor. I've had to raise prices and some customers are dropping me. That's real. That affects my bottom line.
participant_profile: M, 58, Small business owner (landscaping), Pewaukee, lifelong Republican, "taxes and regulations" focus
preceding_moderator_q: Thank you all for joining us tonight. Let's start with how you're experiencing the economy right now. What's top of mind?
